page.title: 16POLICE DOGS
page.content: We have observed many uses of the country area around Rivington and one especially interesting scene is when the police bring their dogs to be trained. A simple white transit van parks at the roadside.Out jump two dogs,superb labradors,with their handlers.A blue material is held before their noses, possibly the scent of something.Later it could be drugs or human stuffs and smells.Off goes one officer and hides the material some hundred metres away, several shrubs and trees clouding the path.The dog is released and without too many swerves finds its way to the hidden treasure.Success! We decided that this had not been too difficult a task for the dogs but that they had already had a lot of basic training.Few of us realised that the park could provide this interest.
